content.raw: Is the plan to support other physics engines in the future or is this an ODE exclusive thing? If it might be extended, it could be good to make this a `TEST_P`?
content.html: Is the plan to support other physics engines in the future or is this an ODE exclusive thing? If it might be extended, it could be good to make this a TEST_P?

content.raw:
Checking self-collisions for a model is not implemented in the other physics engines. The self-collide model element can be set in other physics engines (in SDF and in Model.cc). I originally made this a TEST_P and changed it when I realized when all of the engines were failing besides ODE. I can revert it self-collisions in other physics engines will happen in the future.

Which reminds me--if we want to use DART in Haptix, and we want to arm model to collide with itself, then model self-collisions in DART should be enabled... (@hsu, @scpeters)
content.html:
Checking self-collisions for a model is not implemented in the other physics engines. The self-collide model element can be set in other physics engines (in SDF and in Model.cc). I originally made this a TEST_P and changed it when I realized when all of the engines were failing besides ODE. I can revert it self-collisions in other physics engines will happen in the future.

Which reminds me--if we want to use DART in Haptix, and we want to arm model to collide with itself, then model self-collisions in DART should be enabled... (@hsu, @scpeters)

if (this->sdf->HasElement("self_collide"))
  {
    this->SetSelfCollide(this->sdf->Get<bool>("self_collide"));
  }
  else 
  {
    this->SetSelfCollide(this->GetModel()->GetSelfCollide());
  }

content.raw:
After looking at the test world and expectations, I believe the `self_collide` tag works as follows: before checking collision bitmasks, the ODE collision checker will skip the collision check if both of the following are true:

* the links are from the same model
* both of the links have `self_collide == false` (`NOT (self_collide1 OR self_collide2)`)

Otherwise it will check collision bitmasks and do the rest of the routine.

After understanding this, the [sdformat documentation of self_collide](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/default/sdf/1.5/link.sdf#cl-14), seems true but incomplete:
~~~
If true, the link can collide with other links in the model.
~~~

I'd like to clarify the documentation in `link.sdf` and in the API calls for `[GS]etSelfCollide` in Link.hh and Model.hh.
content.html:
After looking at the test world and expectations, I believe the self_collide tag works as follows: before checking collision bitmasks, the ODE collision checker will skip the collision check if both of the following are true:

  • the links are from the same model
  • both of the links have self_collide == false (NOT (self_collide1 OR self_collide2))

Otherwise it will check collision bitmasks and do the rest of the routine.

After understanding this, the sdformat documentation of self_collide, seems true but incomplete:

If true, the link can collide with other links in the model.

I'd like to clarify the documentation in link.sdf and in the API calls for [GS]etSelfCollide in Link.hh and Model.hh.
